definitions: To injure a muscle or part of the body by overexertion.
To put a severe demand on the strength or resources of.
To pour (a substance) through a sieve or similar device in order to separate out solids or impurities.
examples: He strains to lift the heavy box.
The athlete strains a hamstring during the race.
The constant pressure strains their relationship.
She strains the pasta after cooking.
